data.title: Main Street looking east, Centerville, Indiana
data.text:
c1910 postcard view of Main Street in Centerville, Indiana. This view was looking east from just west of Main Cross Street. A trolley car was stopped near the traction station. The photographer captured a few pedestrians, an automobile, and a horse-drawn vehicle in this view. The building at the left edge of the view housed an agricultural implements business (and the IORM on the second floor) according to the 1896 Sanborn™ fire insurance map set. The 1913 map set shows a hardware business and an unidentified lodge room in that building, but also indicates the building was "boarded up."

From the collection of Thomas Keesling.
